bullets.text: Welcome to today's lecture on Machine Learning basics.
Definition: Teaching computers to learn from data.
Core concept: Learning from data instead of explicit rules.
Method: System trained on labeled data.
Example: Email classified as spam or not spam.
Process: Model learns patterns to predict unseen cases.
Common algorithms: Decision trees, Support Vector Machines, Neural Networks.
Method: System finds patterns in data without labels.
Example: Clustering customers based on purchasing behavior.
Classic algorithm: K-means.
Method: Agent learns by interacting with an environment.
Learning mechanism: Learns from feedback or rewards.
Examples: Training AI for video games or robot control.
Overfitting: Model memorizes training data, performs poorly on new data.
Bias: Occurs when the training data itself is unbalanced.
General concern: Important issues to address in ML development.
Healthcare: Used for disease prediction.
Finance: Applied in fraud detection.
Automotive: Essential for object recognition in self-driving cars.
Next topic: Evaluation metrics.
Metrics to be covered: Accuracy, precision, recall.
Additional metric: F1-score.
